text: "Paradise, Hawaiian Style" is a song first recorded by Elvis Presley as part of the soundtrack for his 1966 motion picture Paradise, Hawaiian Style. Its first release on record was in 1966 on the soundtrack album Paradise, Hawaiian Style. == Writing and recording == The song was written by Bill Giant, Bernie Baum, and Florence Kaye. Presley recorded it on July 27 at the soundtrack recordings for the Paramount movie Paradise, Hawaiian Style (that took place on July 26–27 and August 2–4, 1965 at the Radio Recorders studio in Hollywood, California. The vocal master is a splice of takes 4 and 3. == Track listings == 7" EP Paradise, Hawaiian Style by Elvis Presley with The Jordanaires (RCA Victor, New Zealand) :A1.
